message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.GT 

The paper deals with online optimization and decision-making under uncertainty, which are core topics in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The use of Bayesian methods and Thompson Sampling also suggests a connection to probabilistic modeling and inference. The paper also involves information theory and combinatorial optimization, which are relevant to the subfields of information theory and discrete mathematics. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory).
